docs.lead_paragraph: Amherst, Mass., is a New England college town, dominated by a sweeping tree-shaded green, flanked on the south by a small business section, and on the north by comfortable fraternity houses and the pretty campus of Amherst College.

headline.main: The Drug Scene: Many Students Now Regard Marijuana as a Part of Growing Up; SMOKING OF 'POT' IS FOUND COMMON

docs.abstract: Drug Addiction: Series on use and abuse in US
docs.snippet: Amherst, Mass., is a New England college town, dominated by a sweeping tree-shaded green, flanked on the south by a small business section, and on the north by comfortable fraternity houses and the pretty campus of Amherst College.

docs.lead_paragraph: In Iowa, a baby girl with a shortened and twisted right leg was born to a woman who had taken the hallucinogenic drug LSD before and during her pregnancy.

headline.main: Science's Knowledge on the Misuse of Drugs and How They Act Is Found to Lag; MORE STUDY URGED ON THEIR EFFECTS Centuries-Old Problem of Addiction Poses Questions Thus Far Unanswered

docs.abstract: Drug Addiction: Series on use and abuse in US
docs.snippet: In Iowa, a baby girl with a shortened and twisted right leg was born to a woman who had taken the hallucinogenic drug LSD before and during her pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Haight Street in the heart of San Francisco's Haight-Ashbury district is a cafe called The Drogstore. Day or night, it is crowded with hippies, feeding the hunger that follows a smoke of marijuana, coming down off an LSD trip, or looking for a lid of "pot" or a tab of "acid."

headline.main: The Drug Scene: Dependence Grows; Americans Are Found to Be Increasingly Oriented Toward Wide Variety of Drugs
